snippet: In one of the war’s deadliest insurgent attacks, nine Taliban fighters stormed a government compound, killing at least 44 people and wounding more than 100 in a hostage standoff.
abstract: Nine Taliban fighters dressed as Afghan soldiers storm government compound in western Afghanistan, killing at least 44 people and wounding more than 100 in hostage standoff; incident is among deadliest insurgent attacks in decade-long war.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Sangar Rahimi, Jawad Sukhanyar, Sharifullah Sahak and Habib Zahori.

lead_paragraph: In one of the war’s deadliest insurgent attacks, nine Taliban fighters stormed a government compound, killing at least 44 people and wounding more than 100 in a hostage standoff.

headline.seo: Scores Killed in Taliban Assault and Standoff
headline.main: Taliban Assault on Afghan Compound Leaves Dozens Dead
headline.print_headline: Taliban Attack In Afghan City, Killing Dozens
